JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you want to join a small, friendly department of experts in one of the world’s most famous loudspeaker manufacturers?

We are succeeding with our turnaround which calls for added strength to all departments – especially Finance. Therefore, we need you to secure our financial foundation while we grow.

About the job

As our new Compliance Manager, your main task will be to ensure compliance within the areas of taxation. This includes the preparation of monthly reports on VAT returns and reconciliations. You will also play a key role in preparing our annual tax statement and Transfer Pricing report together with our external tax agent, as well as reviewing risks on contracts with our business partners, changes in our business conduct or specific projects.

Other responsibilities include:

* Providing specialist advice on optimal business and tax setup of entities

* Ensuring fulfilment of reporting requirements towards authorities

* Monitoring the appropriate working of internal control.

* Design, implement and monitor internal control process

* Prevent and detect potential risks Our Finance Director oversees all finance handling in the group including our German, Chinese, and American offices. This means you are to support our Finance Director in handling any aspects of international taxation, risk mitigation and Transfer Pricing issues.

About the department

There are a team of six enthusiastic colleagues at the HQ, working with our five international finance colleagues on controlling, accounting and providing support to our global offices in Germany, the USA and China. We work closely together, supporting each other in our daily tasks, but also place a high value in independent working – especially towards the end of the month. We succeed by working together, and by working closely with colleagues across the organization.

About you

You have an educational background within Taxation or accounting, during which you have gained knowledge and understanding of taxation laws and reporting, and you have at least three years of experience from a similar role in an international company.

Prior experience from e.g. a tax function or an accounting firm will be an advantage.

Your success is determined by your ability to build a constructive dialogue with customers across all organizational levels and functions. You have an analytical and structured work style, and you place a high value in accuracy and meeting legal requirements. You use your well-developed communication skills to establish good working relations with all stakeholders. English is our main company language, so you’ll need to be comfortably fluent in both writing and speaking it too.

About what we offer

An exciting job in an international company with good professional and personal development opportunities, and where you influence the company´s further development. You’ll have a chance to listen to the music you love on some truly amazing speakers (including getting the opportunity to buy them at a pleasing discount), and even get to see behind the scenes on how they’re made, tested and designed in-house at the factory. The salary is negotiated individually at a level that corresponds to the position requirements and your qualifications. If you have any questions, please contact Partner, Søren Wagner Hansen or HR-Partner, Brian Nyborg Halager from COLO Consulting, Search & Selection or Director, Finance, Vincy Zhang at +45 6013 4888 or vinzh@dynaudio.com.

The application

If you also think the job sounds exciting, we will look forward to receiving your application and CV. You can apply via the link below.

About Dynaudio

Dynaudio is one of the world's largest speaker manufacturers. Founded in 1977 in Skanderborg, Denmark, we have more than 40 years of experience in producing high-end speakers. Today, Dynaudio exports to 80 countries around the world and has received awards everywhere for the products. Dynaudio today has approx. 300 employees. Development and production take place in Skanderborg, where Dynaudio, in collaboration with VW and other highly regarded car manufacturers, also develops sound systems. Dynaudio has extreme quality requirements and is highly certified. Late in 2014, Goertek Inc., China, acquired the majority shares of Dynaudio. Goertek Inc. is world leader in the development and manufacturing of 3D glasses and Bluetooth equipment. They’re also the top producer of microphones, flat screens and micro loudspeakers/transducers in the world.
